LTRpred 1.0.0

Estimate retrotransposon insertion age in Mya based on 5' and 3' LTR sequence homology

Source: R/ltr_age_estimation.R
ltr_age_estimation.Rd

This function implements diverse metrics to roughly estimate the insertion age in Mya based on 5' and 3' LTR sequence homology.

ltr_age_estimation(ltr_seqs_3_prime, ltr_seqs_5_prime, model = "K80",
  mutation_rate = 1.3 * 1e-07)

Arguments

ltr_seqs_3_prime

file path to a fasta file storing the sequences of the respective 3' LTR (e.g. as annotatted by LTRpred).
ltr_seqs_5_prime

file path to a fasta file storing the sequences of the respective 5' LTR (e.g. as annotatted by LTRpred).
model

a model as specified in dist.dna: a character string specifying the evolutionary model to be used; must be one of "raw", "N", "TS", "TV", "JC69", "K80" (the default), "F81", "K81", "F84", "BH87", "T92", "TN93", "GG95", "logdet", "paralin".
mutation_rate

a mutation rate per site per year. For retrotransposons the default is mutation_rate = 1.3 * 10E-8 (Wicker and Keller, 2007).

Examples

# NOT RUN {
 {
# }
# NOT RUN {
# define file path to fasta file storing 3' LTR sequences
# }
# NOT RUN {
ltr_seqs_3_prime <- system.file("Hsapiens_ChrY-ltrdigest_3ltr.fas", package = "LTRpred")
# }# NOT RUN {
ltr_seqs_5_prime <- system.file("Hsapiens_ChrY-ltrdigest_5ltr.fas", package = "LTRpred")
# }# NOT RUN {
# estimate insertion age based on 3' and 5' LTR homology using the K80 model
# }
# NOT RUN {
Hsapiens_ltr_age <- ltr_age_estimation(ltr_seqs_3_prime, ltr_seqs_5_prime)
# }# NOT RUN {
# look at results
# }
# NOT RUN {
Hsapiens_ltr_age
# }
